info.title: Legacy Search API
info.description:
> Check the new [Search onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/search-onboarding). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Search and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

This API lets you search and sort products in the Catalog using Fulltext, Category and Brand search terms. 

Retrieve product data to create custom searches and product shelves.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.summary: Get Product Search of Who Saw Also Saw
get.description: Retrieves general information about other related products that the users also saw.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Product unique identifier.

sellers.sellerName: COMPANHIA BRASILEIRA DE TECNOLOGIA PARA E-COMMERCE

productTitle.title: productTitle
productTitle.description: Text that is in the browser tab and corresponds to the title of the product page. This field is important for SEO.

metaTagDescription.title: metaTagDescription
metaTagDescription.description: Brief description of the category. It's recommended that you don't exceed 150 characters so that the search engines can display it correctly in the results page.

categories.title: categories
categories.description: Array of the product's categories URLs.

categoriesIds.title: categoriesIds
categoriesIds.description: Array of the product's categories IDs.

allSpecificationsGroups.title: allSpecificationsGroups
allSpecificationsGroups.description: Array of the product's specifications groups.

description.title: description
description.description: Description of the main information related to the product. A simple and easy to understand summary for the customer.

items.title: items
items.description: Array containing the product SKU general information.

sellers.sellerName: COMPANHIA BRASILEIRA DE TECNOLOGIA PARA E-COMMERCE
COMPANHIA BRASILEIRA DE TECNOLOGIA PARA E-COMMERCE

ean.title: ean
ean.description: SKU unique identification code (barcode), accepts up to 13 numerical characters.

Value.title: Value
Value.description: Unique reference code used internally for organizational purposes.

measurementUnit.title: measurementUnit
measurementUnit.description: Used only in cases when you need to convert the unit of measure for sale. In common cases, use 'un'.

unitMultiplier.title: unitMultiplier
unitMultiplier.description: numerical unit that multiplies the selected quantity of the product when it is inserted in the cart.

isKit.title: isKit
isKit.description: If the SKU is part of a kit.

kitItems.title: kitItems
kitItems.description: Array with information of SKUs components from a Kit.

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Amount of the SKU component in the kit.

images.title: images
images.description: Array of information about the SKU image.

imageLastModified.title: imageLastModified
imageLastModified.description: Date and time of the last update of the image.

example.sellerName: COMPANHIA BRASILEIRA DE TECNOLOGIA PARA E-COMMERCE

addToCartLink.title: addToCartLink

sellerDefault.description: If the seller is default or not.

TotalValuePlusInterestRate.title: TotalValuePlusInterestRate
TotalValuePlusInterestRate.description: Total value plus interest rate of the installment.

PaymentSystemName.title: PaymentSystemName
PaymentSystemName.description: Payment system name of the installment.

PaymentSystemGroupName.title: PaymentSystemGroupName
PaymentSystemGroupName.description: Payment system group name of the installment.

BuyTogether.title: BuyTogether
BuyTogether.description: Array of other products that can be bought together with the product in question.

PriceWithoutDiscount.title: PriceWithoutDiscount
PriceWithoutDiscount.description: Price of the product without discount.

PriceValidUntil.title: PriceValidUntil
PriceValidUntil.description: Price of the product valid until a certain date.

IsAvailable.title: IsAvailable
IsAvailable.description: If the product is available or not.

SaleChannel.title: SaleChannel
SaleChannel.description: Trade policy which the product is contained.

CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout.title: CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout
CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout.description: Cache version used to call checkout.

get.description: Retrieves general information about related product searches.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Product's unique identifier

get.description: Retrieves general information about other product suggestions related to the product.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Product's unique identifier

get.description:
Retrieves general information about the products related to the term searched. 
This is the main search used by the store. The user can type anything to be searched.  

For example, if they search for a "decanter", this is the URL: `https://{{accountName}}.{{environment}}.com.br/api/catalog_system/pub/products/search/decanter`. 

Note that maybe the response can be HTTP 200 or 206, 206 means that it's a partial content response.

If it is a 206 take a look at the Headers, will be an entry called resources. E.g.: resources → 0-9/19. This means that the response is showing items from 0 to 9, 10 items, but there were 19 items found. See more information at the paging route example.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Term used to search products

get.summary: Search for Products with Filter, Order and Pagination
get.description:
Retrieves general information about the store products. This information can be filtered and ordered by a number of options. It also can be paginated, filtered and ordered. 

## Filters  

- **Filter by full text** - `ft={searchWord}`  
E.g.: `ft=television`

- **Filter by category** - `fq=C:/{a}/{b}`  
`{a}` and `{b}` are Category IDs   
E.g.: `fq=C:/1000041/1000049/`

- **Filter by brand** - `fq=B:/{a}/{b}`  
`{a}` and `{b}` are Brand IDs
E.g.: `fq=B:/189385/189387/`

- **Filter by specification** - `fq=specificationFilter_{a}:{b}`  
`{a}` is the specification ID
`{b}` is the specification value
E.g.: To filter products where the color is Blue, find the specification ID for color. Suppose it is 123, then the query will be: `fq=specificationFilter_123:Blue`

- **Filter by price range** - `fq=P:[{a} TO {b}]`  
`{a}`  is the minimum price "from"
`{b}` is the highest price "to"  
E.g.: `fq=P:[0 TO 20]` will search products between 0.00 and 20.00.  

- **Filter by collection** - `fq=productClusterIds:{{productClusterId}}` 
`productClusterId` is the same as `collectionId`  
For more information about collections, read [Creating a product collection](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/creating-a-product-collection).

- **Filter by product ID** - `fq=productId:{{productId}}`

- **Filter by SKU ID** - `fq=skuId:{{skuId}}`

- **Filter by referenceId** - `fq=alternateIds_RefId:{{referenceId}}`

- **Filter by EAN13** - `fq=alternateIds_Ean:{{ean13}}`

- **Filter by availability at a specific sales channel** - `fq=isAvailablePerSalesChannel_{{sc}}:{{bool}}`  
`{{sc}}` is the desired sales channel  
`{{bool}}` is true ou false, 1 or 0.  
E.g.: seaching available products for the sales channel 4 would be `fq=isAvailablePerSalesChannel_4:1`

- **Filter by available at a specific seller** - `fq=sellerId:{{sellerId}}`
The search does not include White Label Sellers.

## Pagination

- **Initial item number** - `_from={{first}}`
- **Final item number** - `_to={{last}}`

>⚠️ This endpoint returns a maximum of 50 items per response, so the difference between `_from` and `_to` should not exceed this number. The result order is descending, from the highest product ID to the lowest.

## Sorting

- **Price**  
`O=OrderByPriceDESC`  
`O=OrderByPriceASC`

- **Top Selling Products**  
`O=OrderByTopSaleDESC`

- **Best Reviews**  
`O=OrderByReviewRateDESC`

- **Name**  
`O=OrderByNameASC`  
`O=OrderByNameDESC`

- **Release Date**  
`O=OrderByReleaseDateDESC`

- **Best Discounts**  
`O=OrderByBestDiscountDESC`

- **Score**  
`O=OrderByScoreDESC`

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: _from
parameters.description: Starter page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

parameters.name: _to
parameters.description: Finisher page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

parameters.name: ft
parameters.description: Filter by full text. The form is`ft={searchWord}`

parameters.name: fq
parameters.description: General filter. It can be by category (`fq=C:/{a}/{b}`), by specification (`fq=specificationFilter_{a}:{b}`),  by price range (`fq=P:[{a} TO {b}]`), by collection (`fq=productClusterIds:{{productClusterId}}`), by product ID (`fq=productId:{{productId}}`),  by SKU ID (`fq=skuId:{{skuId}}`), by Reference ID (`fq=alternateIds_RefId:{{referenceId}}`), by EAN13 (`fq=alternateIds_Ean:{{ean13}}`), by availability at a specific sales channel (`fq=isAvailablePerSalesChannel_{{sc}}:{{bool}}`), by available at a specific seller (`fq=sellerId:{{sellerId}}`)

parameters.name: O
parameters.description: Sorting method. It can be by Price (`O=OrderByPriceDESC` or `O=OrderByPriceASC`), by Top Selling Products (`O=OrderByTopSaleDESC`), by Best Reviews (`O=OrderByReviewRateDESC`), by Name (`O=OrderByNameASC` or `O=OrderByNameDESC`), by Release Date (`O=OrderByReleaseDateDESC`), by Best Discounts (`O=OrderByBestDiscountDESC`), by Score (`O=OrderByScoreDESC`)

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Amount of the SKU component in the kit.

images.title: images
images.description: Array of information about the SKU image.

imageLastModified.title: imageLastModified
imageLastModified.description: Date and time of the last update of the image.

sellerName.example: COMPANHIA BRASILEIRA DE TECNOLOGIA PARA E-COMMERCE

addToCartLink.title: addToCartLink
addToCartLink.description: URL to add the product to the cart.

sellerDefault.title: sellerDefault
sellerDefault.description: If the seller is default or not.

TotalValuePlusInterestRate.title: TotalValuePlusInterestRate
TotalValuePlusInterestRate.description: Total value plus interest rate of the installment.

PaymentSystemName.title: PaymentSystemName
PaymentSystemName.description: Payment system name of the installment.

PaymentSystemGroupName.title: PaymentSystemGroupName
PaymentSystemGroupName.description: Payment system group name of the installment.

BuyTogether.title: BuyTogether
BuyTogether.description: Array of other products that can be bought together with the product in question.

PriceWithoutDiscount.title: PriceWithoutDiscount
PriceWithoutDiscount.description: Price of the product without discount.

PriceValidUntil.title: PriceValidUntil
PriceValidUntil.description: Price of the product valid until a certain date.

IsAvailable.title: IsAvailable
IsAvailable.description: If the product is available or not.

SaleChannel.title: SaleChannel
SaleChannel.description: Trade policy which the product is contained.

CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout.title: CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout
CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout.description: Cache version used to call checkout.

get.description: Retrieves existing offers of a specific product.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Product unique number identifier.

EanId.title: EanId
EanId.description: SKU unique identification code (barcode), accepts up to 13 numerical characters.

RefId.title: RefId
RefId.description: Unique reference code used internally for organizational purposes.

IsActive.title: IsActive
IsActive.description: If the SKU is active or not.

MainImage.title: MainImage
MainImage.description: General information of the main image of the SKU.

ImageId.title: ImageId
ImageId.description: Unique identifier of the association of the Image to the SKU.

IsMain.title: IsMain
IsMain.description: If the image is the main image of the SKU or not.

IsZoomSize.title: IsZoomSize
IsZoomSize.description: If the image has zoom applied.

LastModified.title: LastModified
LastModified.description: Time that the image was last modified.

SellerSkuId.title: SellerSkuId
SellerSkuId.description: ID of the association of the SKU with the seller.

IsAvailable.title: IsAvailable
IsAvailable.description: If the SKU is available or not.

AvailableSalesChannels.title: AvailableSalesChannels
AvailableSalesChannels.description: Trade policy that the SKU in contained.

LastModified.title: LastModified
LastModified.description: Time that the offer was last modified.

parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Category unique number identifier.

parameters.name: _from
parameters.description: Starter page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

parameters.name: _to
parameters.description: Finisher page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

items.description: Object with name and ID of the category's facet.

get.description:
Retrieves products by store facets. 
>⚠️ This endpoint returns a maximum of 50 items per response, so the difference between `_from` and `_to` should not exceed this number. The result order is descending, from the highest product ID to the lowest.

## Response body example:

```json
{
	"Departments": [
  	{
    	"Quantity": 2,
      "Position": null,
      "Name": "Beers Beers Mesmo",
      "Link": "/Beers-Beers-Mesmo/1?map=c,b",
      "LinkEncoded": "/Beers-Beers-Mesmo/1?map=c,b",
      "Map": "c",
      "Value": "Beers-Beers-Mesmo"
     },
     {
     	"Quantity": 2,
      "Position": null,
      "Name": "Merch Integration Category ||",
      "Link": "/Merch-Integration-Category-||/1?map=c,b",

      "Map": "c",
      "Value": "Merch-Integration-Category-||"
     },
     {
      "Quantity": 1,
      "Position": null,
      "Name": "Jogos",
      "Link": "/Jogos/1?map=c,b",
      "LinkEncoded": "/Jogos/1?map=c,b",
      "Map": "c",
      "Value": "Jogos"
     },
     {
      "Quantity": 3,
      "Position": null,

      "Link": "/189/1?map=c,b",
      "LinkEncoded": "/189/1?map=c,b",
      "Map": "c",
      "Value": "189"
     },
     {
      "Quantity": 1,
      "Position": null,
      "Name": "Tests",
      "Link": "/Tests/1?map=c,b",
      "LinkEncoded": "/Tests/1?map=c,b",
      "Map": "c",
      "Value": "Tests"
     },
     {
      "Quantity": 1,
      "Position": null,
      "Name": "Accessories",
      "Link": "/Accessories/1?map=c,b",
      "LinkEncoded": "/Accessories/1?map=c,b",
      "Map": "c",

      "Position": null,

      "Link": "/Bars/1?map=c,b",

      "Map": "b",
      "Value": "Ze"
     },
     {

          },
          {

            "Quantity": 2,

          {
```

parameters.name: map
parameters.description: Mapping of the term. It can be `c` for a category, `b` for a brand, or `specificationFilter_{specificationId}` for a specification. You need to include a map for each term you are searching for in the same term's order.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Describes the type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Term used for the facet's search. You can search for as much term as you want. The term can be: `categoryId`, `brandId`, `specificationId`.

parameters.name: _from
parameters.description: Starter page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

parameters.name: _to
parameters.description: Finisher page range. These parameters allow the API to be paginated. Take into account that the initial and final pages cannot have a separation superior to 50 pages. Thus, it will be displayed 50 items per page.

Departments.title: Departments
Departments.description: Array of general information about the categories.

Brands.title: Brands
Brands.description: Array of general information about the brands.

SpecificationFilters.title: SpecificationFilters
SpecificationFilters.description: Object with general information of specifications.

PriceRanges.title: PriceRanges
PriceRanges.description: Array with general information of the price ranges.

Departments.title: Departments
Departments.description: Departments' quantity of displayed and total items.

CategoriesTrees.title: CategoriesTrees
CategoriesTrees.description: Category tree's quantity of displayed and total items.

Brands.title: Brands
Brands.description: Brands' quantity of displayed and total items.

PriceRanges.title: PriceRanges
PriceRanges.description: Price ranges' quantity of displayed and total items.

SpecificationFilters.title: SpecificationFilters
SpecificationFilters.description: Specification filters' quantity of displayed and total items.

get.description:
Retrieves product's information related to the searched string.
`{{searchString}} is the part of string the user is looking for.
E.g.: `ref` | `refrig` | `refrigerator`

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: productNameContains
parameters.description: Part of the string that will be searched.

schema.title: The root schema
schema.description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.
